Equipment.name: Kokiri Sword
Equipment.description: A sword passed down by the Kokiri. It's said to have been forged by the great Deku Tree himself.
Equipment.acquisition: Found in a treasure chest in the Kokiri Forest, in the training area.

Equipment.name: Master Sword
Equipment.description: The legendary Blade of Evil's Bane. Only one with a hero's spirit can wield it.
Equipment.acquisition: Pulled from the Pedestal of Time in the Temple of Time.

Equipment.name: Deku Shield
Equipment.description: A small, wooden shield. It's light and easy to use, but it will burn if it touches fire.
Equipment.acquisition: Can be purchased from the Kokiri Shop for 40 Rupees.

Equipment.name: Hylian Shield
Equipment.description: A sturdy, metal shield bearing the crest of the Royal Family of Hyrule. It can withstand fire.
Equipment.acquisition: Can be purchased from the Bazaar in Hyrule Castle Town Market for 80 Rupees, or found for free in a grave in the Kakariko Village Graveyard.

Equipment.name: Mirror Shield
Equipment.description: A highly polished shield that can reflect light and certain energy-based projectiles.
Equipment.acquisition: Found in a treasure chest within the Spirit Temple.

Equipment.name: Kokiri Tunic
Equipment.description: The traditional green garb of the Kokiri, the children of the forest.
Equipment.acquisition: Default tunic worn by Link at the start of the game.

Equipment.name: Goron Tunic
Equipment.description: A heat-resistant tunic made by the Gorons. It protects the wearer from extreme heat.
Equipment.acquisition: Given by a young Goron in Goron City who shares Link's name.

Equipment.name: Zora Tunic
Equipment.description: A tunic woven by the Zora. It allows the wearer to breathe underwater.
Equipment.acquisition: Given by King Zora after unfreezing him with Blue Fire.

Equipment.name: Kokiri Boots
Equipment.description: Standard leather boots. Comfortable and reliable for any journey.
Equipment.acquisition: Default boots worn by Link at the start of the game.

Equipment.name: Iron Boots
Equipment.description: Extremely heavy boots that allow the wearer to walk on the bottom of bodies of water.

Equipment.name: Hover Boots
Equipment.description: Mysterious boots that allow the wearer to hover for a short time, but offer poor traction.
Equipment.acquisition: Found in a treasure chest within the Shadow Temple.

Hidden.name: Pokedex
Hidden.description: A peculiar device of unknown origin, humming with a mysterious energy. Its polished red surface is unlike any material found in Hyrule. One might guess it comes from another world, or perhaps another time. It seems to hold data on many strange creatures.
Hidden.acquisition: Its origins are a complete mystery, as if it simply appeared.

Items.name: Deku Stick
Items.description: A long, thin stick from the Great Deku Tree. It can be used as a weapon or to light torches, but it's flammable.
Items.acquisition: Dropped by Deku Babas or purchased from some shops.

Items.name: Deku Nut
Items.description: A hard nut that explodes with a blinding flash when thrown, stunning nearby enemies.
Items.acquisition: Dropped by various enemies or found in chests and under rocks.

Items.name: Bombs
Items.description: Explosives that can be used to defeat enemies or destroy cracked walls and boulders.
Items.acquisition: Obtained in Dodongo's Cavern. Can be purchased from the Goron City shop or the Bazaar.

Items.name: Bombchu
Items.description: A mouse-shaped bomb that travels along the ground and up walls before exploding.
Items.acquisition: Found in various treasure chests or can be purchased at the Bombchu Bowling Alley or from a Carpet Merchant.

Items.name: Fairy Slingshot
Items.description: A slingshot used by the Kokiri. It shoots Deku Seeds.
Items.acquisition: Found in a treasure chest inside the Deku Tree.

Items.name: Fairy Bow
Items.description: A more powerful bow that shoots arrows. Essential for an adult hero.
Items.acquisition: Found in a treasure chest within the Forest Temple.

Items.name: Fire Arrows
Items.description: Magical arrows imbued with the power of fire. Can light torches and burn enemies.
Items.acquisition: Obtained by shooting at the morning sun from the island in Lake Hylia after completing the Water Temple.

Items.name: Ice Arrows
Items.description: Magical arrows imbued with the power of ice. Can freeze enemies.
Items.acquisition: Obtained by completing the Gerudo Training Ground.

Items.name: Light Arrows
Items.description: Sacred arrows imbued with the power of light. The only weapon that can defeat Ganondorf.
Items.acquisition: Given by Zelda after awakening all the Sages.

Items.name: Din's Fire
Items.description: A magical attack that creates a dome of fire, igniting everything in its radius.
Items.acquisition: Obtained from a Great Fairy Fountain near Hyrule Castle.

Items.name: Farore's Wind
Items.description: A magical spell that allows you to create a warp point within a dungeon.
Items.acquisition: Obtained from a Great Fairy Fountain in Zora's Fountain.

Items.name: Nayru's Love
Items.description: A magical spell that creates a protective barrier around Link, making him invincible for a short time.
Items.acquisition: Obtained from a Great Fairy Fountain in the Desert Colossus.

Items.name: Ocarina of Time
Items.description: A mystical ocarina given to Link by Princess Zelda. It holds the power to control time itself.
Items.acquisition: After collecting the three Spiritual Stones, Princess Zelda entrusts it to Link as she flees from Hyrule Castle.

Masks.name: Keaton Mask
Masks.description: A mask of the ghost-like Keaton. It's part of a trading sequence to get the Mask of Truth.
Masks.acquisition: Given by the guard in Kakariko Village to deliver to the soldiers in Hyrule Field.

Masks.name: Skull Mask
Masks.description: A creepy mask that makes you look like a Skull Kid. Some creatures might react differently to it.
Masks.acquisition: Borrowed from the Happy Mask Shop after selling the Keaton Mask.

Masks.name: Spooky Mask
Masks.description: A mask that looks like a ReDead. It's sure to scare someone.
Masks.acquisition: Borrowed from the Happy Mask Shop after selling the Skull Mask.

Masks.name: Bunny Hood
Masks.description: A mask with long, rabbit-like ears. It prevents Stalchildren from appearing in Hyrule Field at night.
Masks.acquisition: Borrowed from the Happy Mask Shop after selling the Spooky Mask. Show it to the Running Man in Hyrule Field.

Masks.name: Goron Mask
Masks.description: A mask that looks like a Goron. It's a novelty item.
Masks.acquisition: Borrowed from the Happy Mask Shop after the Bunny Hood event.

Masks.name: Zora Mask
Masks.description: A mask that looks like a Zora. It's a novelty item.
Masks.acquisition: Borrowed from the Happy Mask Shop after the Goron Mask event.

Masks.name: Gerudo Mask
Masks.description: A mask that looks like a Gerudo. It's a novelty item.
Masks.acquisition: Borrowed from the Happy Mask Shop after the Zora Mask event.

Masks.name: Mask of Truth
Masks.description: Allows you to read the minds of people and animals, and understand Gossip Stones.
Masks.acquisition: The final reward from the Happy Mask Shop trading sequence.
